snippet: The documentary “Red Army” shows a style of hockey played by the Soviets in the 1970s and ’80s that remains unsurpassed for its grace, speed and intricacy.
abstract: Gabe Polsky documentary film Red Army highlights style of hockey played by Soviets in 1970s and 1980s that remains unsurpassed for its grace, speed and intricacy; from 1975 to 1991, soviet club teams compiled a 58-40-10 record against NHL clubs, even though 92 of those 108 games were played in North America.
lead_paragraph: The documentary “Red Army” shows a style of hockey played by the Soviets in the 1970s and ’80s that remains unsurpassed for its grace, speed and intricacy.

headline.seo: 'Red Army' Hockey Documentary Begins Limited Run This Week
headline.main: Bits of Dance and Chess Found in a Vanished Style of Play
headline.print_headline: Bits of Dance and Chess Found in a Vanished Style of Play
